update.description:
* Fix for the RenderWidget_TEST. The widget should be created before the world is loaded.

* Modify ArrowVisual to show/hide objects rather than add/remove. This helps to prevent dangling objects.

* Added a pointer check in OculusCamera.

[Jenkins nogpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/691/)

The previous pull request of this branch was missing the changes to `Visual.hh`
update.title: Issue 1702, part1

update.title: Issue 1702, part1

content.raw: Good point. I'll update the migration guide.
content.html: Good point. I'll update the migration guide.

content.raw: it changes the behavior of their program if they subclass `Visual` and have been calling the base's class `SetVisible` function. Maybe just a corner case. It's true that their code will still compile and run with no changes.
content.html: it changes the behavior of their program if they subclass Visual and have been calling the base's class SetVisible function. Maybe just a corner case. It's true that their code will still compile and run with no changes.

content.raw: Can't users subclass Visual? (That would be a nice feature, to make custom markers or something like that)
content.html: Can't users subclass Visual? (That would be a nice feature, to make custom markers or something like that)

content.raw: This doesn't require a change to a users' code base, so no migration is needed.
content.html: This doesn't require a change to a users' code base, so no migration is needed.

content.raw: Thanks for the clarification. I thought that leaving this here would mean it doesn't call the `Visual` destructor. I have to study better what default means.
content.html: Thanks for the clarification. I thought that leaving this here would mean it doesn't call the Visual destructor. I have to study better what default means.

* Added a pointer check in OculusCamera.

The previous pull request of this branch was missing the changes to `Visual.hh`
update.title: Issue 1702, part1

content.raw: A base class needs a virtual destructor, even if the destructor is empty. In this case no one inherits from ArrowVisual, so we could remove it. If we create a new child class down the road we'll have to put it back in. There is no cost associated with keeping this here, so I'm inclined to leave it as is.
content.html: A base class needs a virtual destructor, even if the destructor is empty. In this case no one inherits from ArrowVisual, so we could remove it. If we create a new child class down the road we'll have to put it back in. There is no cost associated with keeping this here, so I'm inclined to leave it as is.

update.title: Issue 1702, part1

content.raw: This looks good to me except for the comment about the destructor
content.html: This looks good to me except for the comment about the destructor

content.raw: Can we just remove this and let it use the base class destructor?
content.html: Can we just remove this and let it use the base class destructor?

content.raw: I don't think we need to. There are no classes that inherit from JointVisual, and the `virtual` attribute of a function passes to children, grandchildren, etc.
content.html: I don't think we need to. There are no classes that inherit from JointVisual, and the virtual attribute of a function passes to children, grandchildren, etc.

content.raw: [JointVisual](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/b6c40d829693a761f1fd6790e08a952d5481bd37/gazebo/rendering/JointVisual.hh?fileviewer=file-view-default#JointVisual.hh-69) has this too. Should we mark it `virtual` there as well?
content.html: JointVisual has this too. Should we mark it virtual there as well?
